hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Bull Regime Transition via BTC Dominance Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market transitions from STRESS to BULL regime, a sharp 3-day decline in BTC dominance (>5%) while BTC price holds above its 20-day moving average will lead to mean reversion in BTC dominance and outperformance of altcoins over the subsequent 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress periods see capital flight to BTC as safe haven. Transition to bull market triggers rotation into riskier altcoins, creating temporary overshoot in dominance decline that reverts as new capital enters both BTC and alts.
entry_conditions: Regime shifts from STRESS to BULL (confirmed by regime model)
BTC dominance declines >5% over 3 consecutive days
BTC price > 20-day SMA on day of regime transition confirmation

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC dominance returns to within 2% of its 20-day average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: No significant mean reversion in BTC dominance occurs within 10 days post-transition, or altcoins continue outperforming beyond initial rotation period.
